title: Seafood Vocabulary
description: Dive into the vocabulary of seafood, from preparation methods to species and culinary traditions

questions.question: In seafood terminology, what does 'shucking' mean?
options: Removing the head of a shrimp
Opening the shell of an oyster or clam with a special knife

questions.question: What is 'sushi-grade' (or 'sashimi-grade') fish?
options: Fish that is always from Japan
Fish that meets standards for safe raw consumption, typically flash-frozen to kill parasites
Any fresh fish from the ocean

questions.question: In seafood, what does 'deveining' shrimp involve?
options: Removing the dark digestive tract that runs along the back of the shrimp

questions.question: What is 'bisque' in seafood cuisine?
options: A smooth, creamy, richly flavored soup usually made from shellfish

questions.question: In seafood terminology, what does 'en papillote' mean?
options: Cooked in a sealed pouch of parchment paper to steam in its own juices

questions.question: What is 'bouillabaisse'?
options: A traditional Provencal fish stew originating from Marseille, made with various fish and shellfish
A type of bread served with seafood

questions.question: In seafood terms, what does 'bivalve' refer to?
options: A mollusk with a two-part hinged shell, such as clams, oysters, and mussels

questions.question: What is 'gravlax' in seafood cuisine?
options: Salmon cured with salt, sugar, and dill, a Scandinavian specialty

questions.question: In seafood preparation, what does 'butterflying' a shrimp or lobster tail mean?
options: Cutting it nearly in half lengthwise and spreading it open flat

questions.question: What is 'roe' in the seafood world?
options: Fish or shellfish eggs, sometimes enjoyed as a delicacy like caviar

questions.question: In seafood, what does 'sustainable fishing' refer to?
options: Harvesting fish at a rate that allows populations to replenish and ecosystems to remain healthy

questions.question: What is 'escabeche' in seafood cuisine?
options: A dish of fried fish marinated in an acidic sauce with vegetables, served cold or at room temperature

questions.question: In seafood terms, what is 'court-bouillon'?
options: A flavored liquid made with water, wine, vegetables, and herbs used for poaching fish

questions.question: What does 'catch of the day' mean in a restaurant?
options: The freshest fish available that day, recently caught and featured as a special

questions.question: In seafood terminology, what is 'crudo'?
options: An Italian dish of thinly sliced raw fish or shellfish dressed with olive oil and citrus
